title: Dog rescued from Asia saved again in NYC during snowstorm
title_page: Dog rescued from Asia saved again in NYC during snowstorm | Daily Mail Online
text:
A dog that was rescued from an illegal dog meat trade has been saved for a second time after she ran away from her handler in New York City during the middle of this week's blizzard.
Tiffany Lacey, executive director of the Animal Haven in Manhattan said Pandy the female four-year-old mixed-breed was being walked Tuesday when she got spooked and bolted.
Rescue shelter volunteers gave chase but Pandy got away. The dog ran from Soho in lower Manhattan all the way to the entrance to the Lincoln Tunnel in Midtown, where she was in danger of being hit by traffic.
Reunited: Pandy was taken back to Animal Haven in Manhattan night after she had ran away to the Lincoln Tunnel during Tuesday's blizzard
Pandy was rescued for the second time after she was saved by an illegal dog meat trade in Thailand on February 19
About an hour after she ran away, she was spotted by Port Authority police officers, who grabbed the leash still attached to her collar.
The freezing and exhausted pup was taken to ASPCA on East 92nd Street.
Authorities learned the dog had a microchip and were able to return Pandy to Animal Haven at 7pm. She was treated for bloodied paws.
The adorable dog is now back up for adoption at the Animal Haven Shelter
Lacey says Pandy was rescued on February 19th from an illegal dog meat trade in Thailand where the animals are taken from the streets and sold.
The shelter worked together with Soi Dog Foundation, a nonprofit organization for the welfare of dogs located in Phuket.
'She’s doing really well. She’s tired but she’s the sweet girl she always is,' she told the New York Post.
The adorable pup has been put back up for adoption at the Animal Haven Shelter in Soho.
